componentInstanceProperties.value:
Map Of Things is a Lightning Web Component using Leaflet.js.

You can visualize Salesforce records as markers on the map.

Also this component enables the real-time location tracking feature on the map view.


The usage of this component looks like as following.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value: Next chapter shows how this component work with Salesforce Object records.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
To show the records as map markers dynamically, 2 standard functionalities are used in this component.

  • Salesforce Object
  • Change Data Capture


Salesforce Object


A Standard / Custom Object and its 2 fields below are required.

  • Latitude (Decimal)
  • Longitude (Decimal)

Optional fields can be set depending on how you want to show.

  • Pop-up message (String)
  • Marker Icon Url (String)
  • Grouping (String)


Sample Things SObject included in this Package is one of the best ways to test the Map of Things features.


You can see some records of Sample Things below.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
In order to let the records appear in the Map Of Things component, property settings below are required.


=== Property Settings ===

  • SObject API Name
    • SampleThings__c - Sample Things Object
  • Field API Name for Latitude
    • Latitude__c - Latitude
  • Field API Name for Longitude
    • Longitude__c - Longitude

= = = = = = = = = = = = =


Change Data Capture


If the Change Data Capture is enabled on the SObject,

Once some record has been changed, created/updated/deleted, all the records will be re-queried then move to the latest location on the map.

Click here to confirm the Change Data Capture settings.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Here is a Map Of Things component configured to simply show all the Sample Things records below.


Let's try editing Latitude and Longitude for some records on the List View below.

Once it's changed, you will see the markers move to different locations.

You will see not only moving to the locations, also they automatically rotate properly.

Only support with custom marker icon


  • Field API Name for Custom marker icon
    • ﻿CustomIconUrl1__c
  • Adjust scale custom marker icon on map zoom
    • ﻿Checked

• Fit bounds map on marker transition
    • ﻿Checked

    • ﻿Type__c = 'FlagGreen'
